channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: xAI lays out interplanetary ambitions in public all-hands
item.description: On Wednesday, xAI took the rare step of publishing its full 45-minute all-hands presentation to the X platform, making it widely available.

item.title: Two more xAI co-founders are among those leaving after the SpaceX merger
item.description: Since the xAI-SpaceX merger announced last week, which combined the two companies (as well as social media platform X) for a reported $1.25 trillion valuation - the biggest merger of all time - a handful of xAI employees and two of its co-founders have abruptly exited the company, penning long departure announcements online. Some also […]

item.title: iOS 26.3 makes it easier to switch to Android
item.description: On Wednesday, Apple released its latest iOS 26 update, which includes a new process for switching from an iPhone to an Android phone, as previously reported by 9to5Mac. The updated transferring tool can move over data like apps, photos, messages, and even a user's phone number by sitting the two phones side by side. Previously, […]

item.title: As Patagonia Burns, the World May Lose Some of its Most Ancient Trees
item.description: When these trees burn, they release massive amounts of carbon, intensifying the very climate crisis fueling these wildfires.

item.title: ‘Severance’ Will Likely End After Season 4
item.description: Apple's in-house production company, Apple Studios, now fully owns the rights and IP of the Emmy-winning series moving forward.

item.title: Cloud gaming on TVs suddenly looks like the future —2026 is the year the 'no console' world becomes realistic, thanks developments and hardware shortages
item.description: With 4K 120Hz arriving on TV cloud gaming and hardware prices rising, maybe you don't need an Xbox or PS5 any more.

item.title: AI inference startup Modal Labs in talks to raise at $2.5B valuation, sources say
item.description: General Catalyst is in talks to lead the round for the four-year-old startup, according to our sources.

item.title: Anthropic says it’ll try to keep its data centers from raising electricity costs
item.description: Anthropic is the latest AI company promising to limit the impact its data centers have on nearby residents' electricity bills. The company said it would pay higher monthly electricity charges in order to cover 100 percent of the upgrades needed to connect its data centers to power grids. "This includes the shares of these costs […]

item.title: Study of Buddhist Monks Finds Meditation Alters Brain Activity
item.description: Meditation isn’t thinking about nothing. New research reinforces that it’s a mind-altering, dynamic state that promotes focus, learning, and well-being.

item.title: OpenAI Researcher Quits, Warns Its Unprecedented ‘Archive of Human Candor’ Is Dangerous
item.description: The warning is valid, but it's not clear anyone is hearing it.

item.title: 64GB of DDR5 RAM now costs more than a MacBook Air - memory prices have surged 300% in just six months
item.description: 64GB of DDR5 RAM surges from the low $200s to over $1000 in six months, with prices still climbing.

item.title: You Can Rent HP’s Ginormous Gaming Laptops. Here’s Why You Shouldn’t
item.description: Are we heading to a future where we don't even own our PCs, but rent them?

item.title: ‘Heated Rivalry’ Is Bringing New Fans to Hockey. Does the Sport Deserve Them?
item.description: Obsession over a show about two closeted hockey players has brought new fandom to the sport just ahead of the Olympics. But men's hockey's lack of support for LGBTQ+ players and fans is notable.

item.title: Elon Musk Is Winning His War on Government Oversight
item.description: The National Labor Relations Board dropped a case against SpaceX... and washed its hands of all future cases.

item.title: The AI industry has a big Chicken Little problem
item.description: The viral X essay "Something Big Is Happening" claims that AI will soon change the world forever, but we've heard this warning before.

item.title: Jar Jar Binks’ New ‘Star Wars’ Comic Finally Does Something About His Clone Wars Complicity
item.description: How do you answer Jar Jar paving the way for the rise of the Galactic Empire? You let him start a little rebellion, as a treat.

item.title: Apple could defy the RAM crisis with a rumored cheaper MacBook — which sounds like its biggest laptop launch for years
item.description: Apple could deploy its affordable MacBook with shipments of 5 to 8 million units – at a price that'll really shift these laptops.

item.title: Theres still time to snag discounted Valentines Day candy at Amazon and Target
item.description: We found the best deals on Valentine's Day candy at Amazon and Target, including budget-friendly classroom exchange packs.

item.title: The best Breville deals from the Amazon Presidents Day sale — save up to $200
item.description: These are the best Breville deals from the Amazon Presidents' Day Sale.

item.title: The internet mourns James Van Der Beeks death
item.description: The internet paid tribute to beloved actor James Van Der Beek.

item.title: OpenAI disbands mission alignment team, which focused on ‘safe’ and ‘trustworthy’ AI development
item.description: The team's leader has been given a new role as OpenAI's chief futurist, while the other team members have been reassigned throughout the company.

item.title: Why I wish I hadn’t bought my Samsung OLED TV
item.description: In June 2024, in a dusty TV shop empty of customers save myself, my wife, and my kids, I stared deep into the LG C3 and Samsung S90C. I went back and forth between the two OLED screens for easily 20 minutes, happily paralyzed by the choice in front of me. The Video Only salesperson […]
